p: The composition of the type of herbivore leaf damage was different between the experimental sites. At the Dutch site in the novel range, there was mostly chewing damage, while at the Czech and German sites damage by adults and larvae of chrysomelid beetles was most common (Fig. 3; Table S2). Herbivore species observed on the plants were similar between the Czech and the German sites, except for infections of spider mites which only occurred at the Czech site and which was equal among plant origins ( P > 0.11, mean 10%) (Table 3). The Dutch site was dominated by slugs.
